channel.title: Misc on Amir's website
channel.description: Recent content in Misc on Amir's website

item.title: PICO Network Forensics
item.description:
Packets Primer

Description

Download the packet capture file and use packet analysis software to find the flag.

Method

For this challenge we can use wireshark to inspect the pcap file. Upon doing so, we see 9 packets.

If we look at the protocol field of the packets, 4 of these are ARP packets. To filer these out we can do !arp.

These leaves us with 5 packets, the first 3 are in the connection setup phase (TCP handshake).

item.title: PICO Linux Challs
item.description:
Magikarp Ground Mission

We can connect to the machine via SSH and then authenticate with a password.

Then if we type ls and cat the “1of3.flag.txt” file, we get the first part of the flag. We can then follow the same procedure for “instructions-to-2of3.txt”.

This tells: “Next, go to the root of all things, more succinctly /”.

This can be done with cd /. We then follow with ls to see the contents of the directory. Here we can find “2of3.flag.txt” that we can then cat to get the next part of the flag.

item.title: PICO Disk Forensics
item.description:
Big Zip

Again, download the big-zip-files.zip file from the challenge.

If we run file on this file, we can see that it is a zip file.

Now unzip the file and cd into its directory.

To search all files and file names for a specific term, use the command:

grep "<search term>" -r .

Where the search term is “picoCTF” and -r is the recursive flag which will search through subdirectories.
